channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: American man who volunteered for an experimental pig kidney transplant is off dialysis and wants to ‘give some people some hope’
item.description: A pig kidney has kept another New Hampshire man, Tim Andrews, off dialysis for a record seven months and counting.

item.title: Conan O’Brien says ‘you may not be ready’ when your breakthrough moment comes, ‘but you have to take it—and then figure it out on the way’
item.description: "Nowadays, they'd never have picked me. Ever. Ever," the former late-night host said.

item.title: This rain jacket is designed with real Doppler radar patterns
item.description: Now here’s a raincoat that won’t be missed in a busy street. Cleverhood, a Rhode Island apparel company, turned weather radar graphics into a colorful...

item.title: Prabowo removes finance chief, risking turmoil for Indonesia
item.description: Sri Mulyani Indrawati become a target of recent protests over the cost of living and fresh perks for lawmakers, unrest that Prabowo is keen to defuse.

item.title: DoorDash is ready for you to pay attention
item.description: On August 18th, Zaria Parvez announced she was leaving Duolingo after five years, eight billion impressions, and more viral moments with a giant Owl t...

item.title: Apple’s ‘Awe Dropping’ iPhone Event Is Tomorrow. Here’s What to Expect
item.description: An iPhone 17 Air, new Apple Watches, and maybe new AirPods and AirTags could all be revealed at Apple’s next event.

item.title: 2 Salesforce Ventures investors see risk and reward in the robotics space after a $7 billion leap forward in 2024
item.description: How to evaluate robotics startups: a VC’s guide to the next AI frontier.

item.title: Am I Expecting Too Much When Interviewing Students?
item.description: … and two other tricky workplace dilemmas.

item.title: There’s No Such Thing as Too Many LinkedIn Posts, Says a New Analysis of 2 Million of Them
item.description: Yes, LinkedIn has an AI slop problem, but if you’re looking to build a following on the platform, more is still more.

item.title: PwC’s U.K. chief admits he’s cutting back entry-level jobs and taking a ‘watch and wait’ approach to see how AI changes work
item.description: The Big Four accounting firm is slashing 200 of Gen Z’s entry-level roles thanks to the AI revolution and struggling global markets.

item.title: After ICE’s raid on Georgia’s Hyundai plant, South Korea will fly its nearly 300 citizens back home
item.description: South Korea said on Monday that it wants hundreds of its citizens, who were arrested last week during a large U.S. immigration raid at a car battery p...

item.title: Why Skilled Trades Are in High Demand, Despite Weak Jobs Report
item.description: Despite — or because of — AI’s rise, it’s a great time to become a plumber, electrician, or HVAC engineer.

item.title: 6 Essential Workshops Your Company Should Schedule This Year
item.description: Unsure what training you should offer employees this year? Leadership development and collaboration should be a priority.

item.title: The 2025 Venice Film Festival is over. Who won big?

item.title: The vibe coding hangover is upon us
item.description: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong was the recipient of some very bad vibes last week after bragging on X that nearly half his exchange’s code is already AI...
